MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.ML.Trainers.MatrixFactorizationTrainer MatrixFactorization (string matrixColumnIndexColumnName, string matrixRowIndexColumnName, string labelColumn = "Label", Action<Microsoft.ML.Trainers.MatrixFactorizationTrainer.Arguments> advancedSettings = null);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.ML.Trainers.MatrixFactorizationTrainer MatrixFactorization(string matrixColumnIndexColumnName, string matrixRowIndexColumnName, string labelColumn, class System.Action`1<class Microsoft.ML.Trainers.MatrixFactorizationTrainer/Arguments> advancedSettings) cil managed

Public Function MatrixFactorization (matrixColumnIndexColumnName As String, matrixRowIndexColumnName As String, Optional labelColumn As String = "Label", Optional advancedSettings As Action(Of MatrixFactorizationTrainer.Arguments) = null) As MatrixFactorizationTrainer

Docs.param: The name of the column hosting the matrix's column IDs.
The name of the column hosting the matrix's row IDs.
The name of the label column.
A delegate to apply all the advanced arguments to the algorithm.
Docs.summary: Train a matrix factorization model. It factorizes the training matrix into the product of two low-rank matrices.

remarks.para: The basic idea of matrix factorization is finding two low-rank factor marcies to apporimate the training matrix.
In this module, the expected training data is a list of tuples. Every tuple consists of a column index, a row index, and the value at the location specified by the two indexes.
